Progress is turning a disability into a superpower.

Arnaud Assoumani is challenging conventions to one day compete as both a Paralympian and Olympian. #DoWhatYouCant spr.ly/Rio2016_AAF.

Progress is proving the strength of motherhood.

Alysia Montano is setting an example to women everywhere that dreams don’t have to be put on hold. #DoWhatYouCant spr.ly/Rio2016_AMF.

Progress is coming back from defeat even stronger.

Shelley Watts turned a devastating injury into a championship-winning boxing career. #DoWhatYouCant spr.ly/Rio2016_SWF.

Progress is never, ever giving up.

Tsepo Mathibelle is out to be the ultimate Olympic comeback story. #DoWhatYouCant spr.ly/Rio2016_TMF.

Progress is a female boxing champion.

Yenebier Guillen was one fight away from making it to Rio. But she’ll never give up the fight. #DoWhatYouCant spr.ly/Rio2016_YGF.

Progress is letting nothing hold you back.

Linline Matauatu and Pata Miller didn’t let their humble origins define their destiny. #DoWhatYouCant spr.ly/Rio2016_LMF.

Progress is witnessing your country’s first Olympics. 

Margret Rumat Rumat Hassan ran when South Sudan didn’t even exist. #DoWhatYouCant spr.ly/Rio2016_MHF.
